about.help: Part Engineering was retrieved from Youtube from the channel J. Christopher Anderson, and was created on 10/22/2013.

contents.params: Part Engineering involves digging into the internal sequence of a part to change its function.  Often the part encodes a protein, and in such cases this is called protein engineering.  However, DNA and RNA-coding parts also can be the subject of engineering.

Part engineering is the aggregation of protein, promoter, RNA engineering, and the like.  Sometimes a genetic device can only be concretized by the addition of a non-natural biochemical component, and for such applications one must apply part engineering to generate a synthetic part.

The site-specific incorporation of unnatural amino acids into proteins in live cells was demonstrated by Schultz and coworkers in the early 2000's.  This methodology has been expanded upon greatly since that time.  These systems are a examples of the integration of engineered part into genetic devices as well as the use of device engineering to construct genetic selections.
